section.name: Welcome to Wicket
section.p: Wicket is a Java web application framework that takes simplicity, separation of concerns and ease of development to a whole new level. Wicket pages can be mocked up, previewed and later revised using standard WYSIWYG HTML design tools. Dynamic content processing and form handling is all handled in Java code using a Swing-like component model backed by POJO data beans that can easily be persisted with Hibernate.

subsection.name: December 26, 2004 - 0.9.16-beta released
subsection.p: The Wicket team is proud to present yet another release of the Wicket core framework and it's examples. This release contains among a number of bug fixes also new support for dynamic languages, (see the Wicket-examples project for more information) and for Spring framework integration.

subsection.name: December 19, 2004 - 0.9.15-beta released
subsection.p: The Wicket team is proud to present yet another release of the Wicket core framework. This release encompasses a big restructuring of the package structure: the com.voicetribe package prefix has been dropped. All Wicket classes are now in the top level package named wicket.

subsection.name: December 19, 2004 - Going into beta
subsection.p: Finally the Wicket development team is starting the march to the big 1.0 release. This sunday the last release of 2004 is done. After this the release candidate circus will be part of our daily Wicket development.
